result.execSummary:
The defendant Jovante Gerard Winston was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Submit DNA sample. Pay all costs and surcharges or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment. Cash bail applied.

- Letter of apology to Elaine H.
- Maintain absolute sobriety to be monitored by random urine screens.
- AODA assessment/treatment deemed appropriate.
- Obtain GED/Barber/Cosmetology
- Complete a parenting class.
- Perform 25 hours of community service.

timeConds.notes: STAYED; to be used by agent for any violations

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with E. HAYNES, 1128 N 20TH ST., AND 1150 N 20TH ST.

Defendant Jovante Gerard Winston in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  Defendant Jovante Gerard Winston in custody.  Katryna L. Childs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
